name: Nansat
tagline: Scientist friendly Python toolbox for processing 2D satellite Earth observation data.
body:
![nansat-logo](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/raw-attachment/wiki/LogoPage/nansat_logo_s.png)
The main **goal** of Nansat is to facilitate:
* easy development and testing of scientific algorithms,
* easy analysis of geospatial data, and
* efficient operational processing.

Nansat is a **framework** which:
* Reads geospatial data from different Earth Observation satellites and from models;
* Adds scientific meaning to the data stored in files;
* Performs basic operations with geospatial data: geo-referencing, visualization, averaging, etc;
* Exports data to figures and NetCDF/CF-files

Nansat is heavily based on **GDAL** (and Numpy, Scipy, Matplotlib, PIL, Basemap).

* [Download](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/Download) - download Nansat source code
* [Requirements](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/Install/Requirements) - list of required software and installation hints
* [Install Nansat](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/Install/Nansat) - how to install Nansat
* [Tutorial](https://github.com/nansencenter/nansat/blob/master/tutorial/tutorial.py) - one page of code with examples and exhaustive explanations
* [SupportedData](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/SupportedData) - list of supported satellites, sensors, formats, levels
* [BugReport](https://github.com/nansencenter/nansat/issues?state=closed) - submit a ticket with bug/improvement description
* [API reference] - brief description of Nansat classes and detailed documentation of every method
* For developers
 * [nansat-dev](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/nansat-dev) - mailing list and forum
 * [GeneralDescription](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/GeneralDescription) 
 * [Programming conventions](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/Conventions)
 * [How to create a new mapper](https://svn.nersc.no/nansat/wiki/Design/Mappers) - instructions on how to add new satellites/sensors/data types
 * [GDAL data model](http://gdal.org/gdal_datamodel.html)
 * [GDAL VRT file tutorial](http://www.gdal.org/gdal_vrttut.html)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
